articles.title: Rare and mysterious ‘fairy circles’ of Namibia and Australia aren’t so rare after all - CNN
articles.description: The origins of “fairy circles” have intrigued scientists for years. The discs of barren dirt that look like polka dots may be more widespread than once thought, a study found.
articles.content:

articles.author: Richard Pallardy
articles.title: The strange story of sharks that lived in a golf course pond for 20 years — then vanished - Livescience.com
articles.description: In the 1990s, a group of juvenile bull sharks were left stranded in a golf course pond in Australia, where they thrived for decades. Now scientists are trying to understand why.
articles.content:
Unlike many other shark species, bull sharks (Carcharhinus leucas) are able to survive in freshwater environments such as rivers. (Image credit: ullstein bild/Getty Images)
